t: Psalm 44
Israel’s Complaint
For the choir director. A Maskil of the sons of Korah.
God,*pn we have heard with our ears — our*ln ancestors have told us — the*ln work you accomplished in their days, in*ln days long ago:
In*ln order to plant them, you*ln displaced the nations by your hand; in*ln order to settle them, you*ln brought disaster on the peoples.

For*ln they did not take the land by their sword — their*ln arm did not bring them victory — but*ln by your right hand, your arm, and*ln the light of your face, because*ln you were favorable toward them.
You*pn are my King, my God, who*ln ordains victories for Jacob.
Through*ln you we drive back our foes; through*ln your name we trample our enemies.
For*ln I do not trust in my bow, and*ln my sword does not bring me victory.
But*ln you give us victory over our foes and*ln let those who hate us be disgraced.
We*ln boast in God all day long; we*ln will praise your name forever. Selah*ig
But*pn you have rejected and humiliated us; you*ln do not march out with our armies.
You*ln make us retreat from the foe, and*ln those who hate us have*ln taken plunder for themselves.
You*ln hand us over to be eaten like sheep and*ln scatter us among the nations.
You*ln sell your people for nothing; you*ln make no profit from selling them.
You*ln make us an object of reproach to our neighbors, a*ln source of mockery and ridicule to those around us.
You*ln make us a joke among the nations, a*ln laughingstock among the peoples.
My*ln disgrace is before me all day long, and*ln shame has covered my face,
because*ln of the taunts of the scorner and reviler, because*ln of the enemy and avenger.
All*pn this has happened to us, but*ln we have not forgotten you or*ln betrayed your covenant.
Our*ln hearts have not turned back; our*ln steps have not strayed from your path.
But*ln you have crushed us in a haunt of jackals and*ln have covered us with deepest darkness.
If*ln we had forgotten the name of our God and*ln spread out our hands to a foreign god,
wouldn’t*ln God have found this out, since*ln he knows the secrets of the heart?
Because*ln of you we are being put to death all day long; we*ln are counted as sheep to be slaughtered.
Wake*pn up, Lord!*s Why are you sleeping? Get*ln up! Don’t reject us forever!
Why*ln do you hide and*ln forget our affliction and oppression?
For*ln we have sunk down to the dust; our*ln bodies cling to the ground.
Rise*ln up! Help us! Redeem*ln us because of your faithful love.
